overview: JSON2Markdown Renderer is a tool designed to convert JSON data into Markdown, making it especially useful for providing a quick overview or for non-developers to read.
how_it_works:
The conversion process begins by using the [json2markdown](https://github.com/memochou1993/json2markdown) package to parse the JSON data into Markdown, followed by using [markdown2html](https://github.com/memochou1993/markdown2html) to convert the Markdown into sanitized HTML.

In this process:
- Objects are converted into headings and content.
- Arrays are converted into lists.
- Arrays of objects are converted into tables.
- Markdown content is preserved.
- HTML content is sanitized.

The following shows how different types of JSON data appear after being converted into Markdown.

json_array_of_objects.name: New Moon
json_array_of_objects.description: A new moon, the first of the eight phases of the moon.

json_array_of_objects.name: Waxing Crescent Moon
json_array_of_objects.description: A waxing crescent moon, the second of the eight phases of the moon.

json_array_of_objects.name: First Quarter Moon
json_array_of_objects.description: A first quarter moon, the third of the eight phases of the moon.

json_array_of_objects.name: Waxing Gibbous Moon
json_array_of_objects.description: A waxing gibbous moon, the fourth of the eight phases of the moon.

json_array_of_objects.name: Full Moon
json_array_of_objects.description: A full moon, the fifth of the eight phases of the moon.

json_array_of_objects.name: Waning Gibbous Moon
json_array_of_objects.description: A waning gibbous moon, the sixth of the eight phases of the moon.

json_array_of_objects.name: Last Quarter Moon
json_array_of_objects.description: A last quarter moon, the seventh of the eight phases of the moon.

json_array_of_objects.name: Waning Crescent Moon
json_array_of_objects.description: A waning crescent moon, the eighth of the eight phases of the moon.
